body:
Hi @mohsenkashi, some questions:

1. Is it possible to run a `sbt clean` so that we can confirm this is not being caused by previous compilations with another Play version? The root cause here is this:

```Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Could not load requested class : models.Person
        at org.hibernate.boot.registry.classloading.internal.ClassLoaderServiceImpl$AggregatedClassLoader.findClass(ClassLoaderServiceImpl.java:217)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:424)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
        at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:348)
        at org.hibernate.boot.registry.classloading.internal.ClassLoaderServiceImpl.classForName(ClassLoaderServiceImpl.java:226)
        at org.hibernate.boot.model.source.internal.annotations.AnnotationMetadataSourceProcessorImpl.<init>(AnnotationMetadataSourceProcessorImpl.java:103)
        at org.hibernate.boot.model.process.spi.MetadataBuildingProcess$1.<init>(MetadataBuildingProcess.java:147)
        at org.hibernate.boot.model.process.spi.MetadataBuildingProcess.complete(MetadataBuildingProcess.java:141)
        at org.hibernate.jpa.boot.internal.EntityManagerFactoryBuilderImpl.metadata(EntityManagerFactoryBuilderImpl.java:848)
```
So, I'm not sure this is related to the use of `JPA` or something else.

2.  If `sbt clean` does not solve the problem, could you please create a small project that shows this problem?

Thanks.

I test sbt clean several times.
I push my simple project here:
https://github.com/mohsenkashi/play26di
With commenting unused inject in `HomeController.java` , error will be raise

I just downloaded your example project and it worked for me with both the `run` and `start` commands. Is there anything else I should do to replicate this?

The only thing I can think of is that class loading issues can sometimes happen when threads don't have the correct context `ClassLoader` set for them. This should be something Play does automatically, but possibly this is somehow behaving differently on your machine than on my one.

Hi @richdougherty 
Did you read my previous comment?
Removing unused inject constructor causes the bug.
See this branch:
https://github.com/mohsenkashi/play26di/tree/bug

issue.title: Make sure injector uses application ClassLoader

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Fixes #7535.

We need to set the thread context ClassLoader before we inject a class, because that class may itself use reflection when it initializes.

This fixes an issue where in dev mode initialization of the @Transactional annotation in dev mode fails to find the application's model classes. This is because in dev mode there are multiple ClassLoaders so we need to be careful about always using the correct ClassLoader when we load classes reflectively or call an API, such as JPA, which uses reflection internally.

body: @mohsenkashi, I must have read your bug description a bit too quickly! A fix is now in progress here: #7552.
Hi @mohsenkashi, this issue is now addressed in Play 2.6.1 if you want to try it out.
